intro: Tecoma gaudichaudii, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is a deciduous shrub or small tree that produces striking yellow, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Tecoma gaudichaudii thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular ornamental plant. Its flowers attract pollinators such as bees and birds, contributing to its ecological significance.
